programme.title: World's Most Scenic Railway Journeys
programme.desc: Telling the stories of epic train journeys through stunning landscapes all around the world, and meeting the characters who travel, work and live near them.

programme.title: Around the World by Train with Tony Robinson
programme.desc: Voyaging into Canada, Tony plays ice hockey, chases elk, and is humbled by the Alaskan glaciers.

programme.title: Walking Wartime Britain
programme.desc: Pilot and former Royal Marine, Arthur Williams, walks across Britain to discover the people and places that changed the course the Second World War, he begins his journey in Liverpool.

programme.title: Tony Robinson's History of Britain
programme.desc: Tony takes us back to the beginning of last century. It's a time of elegance, innovation, class division and social progress: the Edwardian period, and he begins with two people who travelled on the Titanic.

programme.title: Forged in Fire
programme.desc: The bladesmiths are tasked with the challenge of shaping four very different types of metal into a fully functional deadly weapon. Two will have just five days to make one of the most lethal weapons in military history, the Nepalese Kukri.

programme.title: Forged in Fire
programme.desc: The bladesmiths are given a twisted challenge when they are asked to create a weapon from cable steel. After two rounds only two are left to return home and forge an Egyptian Khopesh.

programme.title: World's Greatest Warships
programme.desc: How British experimentation during WWI eventually led to the first purpose-built aircraft carrier.

programme.title: Around the World by Train with Tony Robinson
programme.desc: Riding both a local railway and the legendary bullet train, Tony explores the samurai of Kyushu, and the neon lights of Tokyo. The last leg of his Japanese journey sees the bullet shooting Tony further north, emerging in the thick snow of Hakodate.

programme.title: Cruising With Susan Calman
programme.desc: Susan Calman sets sail again on the high seas in search of brand new adventures, starting in the Canary Islands and Madeira, moving onto the Mediterranean and finally heading further afield, sailing from Florida to explore the Caribbean.

programme.title: Inside the Tower of London
programme.desc: The Tower of London opens up for an access-all-areas look at one of the UK's most incredible and iconic sites as well as the people who live and work there, uncovering 900 years of history and secrets, from murdered Princes to beheaded Queens.

programme.title: The Yorkshire Vet
programme.desc: A chance to revisit some of the best cases as our Yorkshire vets come to the aid of all creatures - great and small.

programme.title: Teleshopping
programme.desc: Shopping from home.

programme.title: Teleshopping
programme.desc: Shopping from home.

programme.title: Murder, She Wrote
programme.desc: Jessica is accused of bribery and false testimony by the daughter of a convicted murderer who is killed in an attempted jailbreak.

programme.title: NCIS
programme.desc: Gibbs interrogates a convict that is about to be executed in order to find out where he hid his victims, but when the plan doesn't work out, the team must solve the case in its own way.

programme.title: NCIS
programme.desc: When the corpse of a man is found inside a tomb from the Civil War, the team discover that the victim was a sergeant buried alive. Elsewhere, Gibbs finds out that Ziva is now a full-time NCIS agent.

programme.title: Law & Order
programme.desc: A man dies when a church is burnt down, and the killer claims he did it to save his daughter.

programme.title: Law & Order
programme.desc: Green and Cassady investigate when a female rapper is murdered. The victim wasn't going to win any popularity contests, using her insult-loaded lyrics to launch withering attacks on her peers. Was she silenced, or was the death a random act of violence?

programme.title: Law & Order
programme.desc: Green and Cassady get mixed up with the Russian consulate after Peter Rostov dies of ricin poisoning. Their investigation leads them first to his work, where they learn he spent a great deal of time traveling back and forth between Russia, and secondly to his brother, Karl.

programme.title: Law & Order
programme.desc: A psychiatrist is killed, and his wife, a former patient, is the prime suspect.

programme.title: Entertainment News On 5
programme.desc: A daily round-up of showbiz news and gossip from around the world, focusing on celebrities, movies, music and entertainment.

programme.title: Law & Order
programme.desc: A dogfight leads to the gruesome discovery of a woman's finger in a dead dog, then the eventual discovery of her body.

programme.title: Law & Order
programme.desc: An art dealer is stoned to death and the cops search for someone with religious motives.

programme.title: NCIS
programme.desc: Gibbs and the team are called in when a couple of kids stumble upon the body of a missing marine in a frozen lake. As the NCIS team searches the frozen lakebed for clues, they come across three more bullet-ridden bodies.

programme.title: NCIS
programme.desc: When a Pentagon cryptographer is found dead, the NCIS team have to determine whether the victim was a mole or not, and if she committed suicide or was murdered.

programme.title: NCIS
programme.desc: While working on a seemingly regular murder case with the rest of the NCIS team, Abby is almost killed and it soon becomes clear that the murder was staged and that someone wants her dead. The team must race to find the killer before it's too late.

programme.title: The Blacklist
programme.desc: Emmy-Award winner James Spader portrays Red Reddington, the world's most wanted criminal in an electrifying new US drama delivering conspiracy and action.

programme.title: Law & Order: Special Victims Unit
programme.desc: The SVU searches for three women suspected of drugging and robbing wealthy men; the case leads to personal connections for both Benson and Kat.

programme.title: Law & Order: Special Victims Unit
programme.desc: Rollins must revisit an old case when a child sent to juvenile detention is released after his 18th birthday.

programme.title: Law & Order: Special Victims Unit
programme.desc: When the squad tries to solve an assault in Central Park, they are hampered by their own blind spots and a community that is losing trust in the police.

programme.title: Law & Order: Special Victims Unit
programme.desc: Rollins and Kat respond to a dangerous domestic violence call while Fin gives his deposition in the lawsuit against him.

programme.title: Law & Order: Criminal Intent
programme.desc: The suspected suicide of a high school student from a prestigious academy turns out to be murder.

programme.title: Law & Order: Criminal Intent
programme.desc: The investigation into the death of a sex offender who was harassed by local police becomes more complicated after sources in the NYPD and the DA's office suggest, contrary to the evidence, that it may be the act of a serial killer.

programme.title: Criminals: Caught on Camera
programme.desc: In this episode we see how CCTV is used to help the cops catch reckless and dangerous drivers.

programme.desc: Shopping from home.

programme.title: NCIS
programme.desc: When an officer is shot dead on the freeway, the NCIS team take on the investigation. The discovery that the victim was leading a double life leads them to possibly solving the crime, but the tables are turned when the victim's dying message is discovered, pointing to a totally different clue.

programme.title: NCIS
programme.desc: When a six-year-old boy informs the NCIS team that his father was kidnapped, the team discover that the missing man is actually a lieutenant commander working on a secret project.

programme.title: NCIS
programme.desc: When the bodies of two hired assassins are delivered to the NCIS team, Ziva and Tony go undercover, assuming the victims' identities in order to find out who hired the assassins.

programme.title: Law & Order
programme.desc: When a young boy is kidnapped and killed, another kidnapping victim is found after five years of confinement.

programme.title: Entertainment News On 5
programme.desc: A daily round-up of showbiz news and gossip from around the world, focusing on celebrities, movies, music and entertainment.

programme.title: Law & Order
programme.desc: Two homeless men are beaten to death, and the Detectives quickly learn that a nearby car dealership security camera caught a beating on tape - one of them was one of the victims. As the investigation deepens, they learn one of the victims was in the Army in Iraq and one of the suspects was a soldier in Iraq - an odd coincidence that may connect the deaths.

programme.title: Law & Order
programme.desc: Detective Cyrus Lupo's return to the mean streets of New York is marred when his seriously ill brother commits suicide by lethal injection. The tragedy is hit with a twist when a death in identical circumstances takes place. Lupo and Green investigate and are led to a parolee nicknamed `Dr Death' and his daughter.

programme.title: Law & Order
programme.desc: Detective Green shoots a suspect in the killing of a crooked basketball referee, and the secrets of his past gambling problems come to light as everyone tries to clear his name.

programme.title: Entertainment News On 5
programme.desc: A daily round-up of showbiz news and gossip from around the world, focusing on celebrities, movies, music and entertainment.

programme.title: Law & Order
programme.desc: A controversial religion is behind two mysterious deaths, and going up against the `system' is challenging.

programme.title: Law & Order
programme.desc: A legal aid worker on strike is killed on the picket line, and Rubriso goes up against Cutter when she's asked to defend the suspect.

programme.title: NCIS
programme.desc: When a suspect dies in custody, Ziva is criticised for her tactics, which may have been indirectly responsible. Things develop further when the suspect's brother, unaware of his sibling's death, kidnaps Jenny and demands that he is released.

programme.title: NCIS
programme.desc: While working on an assignment, Gibbs is seriously injured in an explosion and taken to hospital where he recalls his painful and hidden past. The rest of the team must proceed with the investigation and put their feelings towards Gibbs's injury aside. Tony is left in charge, which may cause a bit of trouble.

programme.title: NCIS
programme.desc: The NCIS team must work on an assignment against a terrorist group without Gibbs, who is still recovering from the explosion. Gibbs struggles with memory loss and is visited by his mentor and former boss. His help is vital, especially when the team discovers that Gibbs is the only person who has information about the terrorists' plans, which he needs to remember before the terrorists attack.

programme.title: Law & Order: Special Victims Unit
programme.desc: The search for a missing witness leads Fin and Kat down a dangerous path; Chief McGrath puts pressure on Garland and Benson to get a conviction.

programme.title: Law & Order: Criminal Intent
programme.desc: Wheeler and her new partner Zach Nichols investigate when an aspiring musician is killed, and one of his friends is thrown to his death from an elevator shaft.

programme.title: Law & Order: Special Victims Unit
programme.desc: Garland asks Benson to investigate an unusual domestic violence case when his neighbour is found injured.

programme.title: Law & Order: Special Victims Unit
programme.desc: While Fin and Phoebe make wedding plans, Benson and Rollins try to help a homeless single mother who's being trafficked in exchange for safe housing.

programme.title: Law & Order: Special Victims Unit
programme.desc: The SVU questions a group of college roommates when one of them goes missing during COVID-19 lockdown.

programme.title: Law & Order: Criminal Intent
programme.desc: Logan goes to war with an ambitious A.D.A.

programme.title: Law & Order: Criminal Intent
programme.desc: Goren's brother is murdered, and his old nemesis, Nicole Wallace, appears to be the killer.

programme.title: Great British Railway Journeys
programme.desc: Crossing the Solent with a ticket to Ryde, Michael boards the Island Line to travel along the pier in a 1930s London Underground carriage then hops on to the Isle of Wight heritage line bound for Wootton. His destination is Osborne House, where the future King Edward VII spent much of his childhood.

programme.title: The Joy of Painting with Bob Ross
programme.desc: Bob Ross paints a crashing waves seascape with a golden sunset sky in the background.

programme.title: The Impressionists: Painting and Revolution
programme.desc: Waldemar Januszczak focuses on the people impressionists painted, particularly the subjects of Degas, Caillebotte and the often forgotten female impressionist artists. Waldemar also reveals how Degas consistently challenged traditions and strove to record real life as it appeared in the city.

programme.title: Britain's Lost Masterpieces
programme.desc: In Cardiff, a fake restoration reveals a Madonna. Emma Dabiri explores the story of the two Welsh sisters who donated the work while Bendor Grosvenor looks for proof of a link with Botticelli.

programme.title: Russia 1985-1999: TraumaZone
programme.desc: The group around the president believe a war in Chechnya will save him. Others want the war to restore the glory of the Russian empire. The Oligarchs seize control of practically everything. In the upside down world gangsters become heroes for defending democracy.

programme.title: Russia 1985-1999: TraumaZone
programme.desc: A massive boom spreads through Moscow. It seems that capitalism has arrived. But suddenly the western bankers flee taking the money with them. The Oligarchs take control of a ruined society and search for a new president who they believe will make them safe. And who they can control. The Russian people turn against what they called `the curse of democracy'. Both communism and democracy are finished.

programme.title: The Impressionists: Painting and Revolution
programme.desc: Waldemar Januszczak focuses on the people impressionists painted, particularly the subjects of Degas, Caillebotte and the often forgotten female impressionist artists. Waldemar also reveals how Degas consistently challenged traditions and strove to record real life as it appeared in the city.

programme.title: Ancient Worlds
programme.desc: Archaeologist and historian Richard Miles examines the phenomenon of the Roman Republic, from its fratricidal mythical beginnings, with the legend of Romulus and Remus, to the all too real violence of its end, dragged to destruction by war lords like Pompey the Great and Julius Caesar.

programme.desc: Michael Portillo promises to do his best on the island where Robert Baden Powell began the scout movement in the early 20th century. Joining a group of modern scouts he learns to build a bivouac and finds out what it is about scouting that still appeals to boys and girls today.

programme.title: The Joy of Painting with Bob Ross
programme.desc: Bob Ross uses a golden sky to illuminate his wintery scene of a snow-topped shack by the pond.

programme.title: As Time Goes By
programme.desc: After a chance encounter, two ex-lovers meet once more after a 38 year separation, only to discover that a lost letter was all that kept them apart.

programme.title: The Mistress
programme.desc: Luke realises that he must fulfil his promise to Maxine and spend a whole weekend with her.

programme.title: A History of Britain by Simon Schama
programme.desc: Simon Schama tells the story of the reformation from Henry the Eighth's passion for Anne Boleyn to Bloody Mary's unsuccessful attempt to return the country to Roman Catholicism.

programme.title: Storyville
programme.desc: An investigation into a spyware called Pegasus, sold to governments around the world by Israeli company NSO Group and used on journalists, activists and others, including both the wife and fiancée of Saudi dissident Jamal Khashoggi.

programme.title: Ancient Worlds
programme.desc: In the last of the series, Richard Miles examines the rise and fall of the Roman Empire. The material benefits of the `good order' delivered by Roman rule provided its citizens and subjects with the security to ask profound questions about the meaning of life, questions that the Roman belief system was ill-equipped to answer. Christianity grew to fill the spiritual vacuum, and the City of Man was eclipsed the City of God.

programme.title: The Magic of Mushrooms
programme.desc: Professor Richard Fortey delves into the fascinating and normally hidden kingdom of fungi. From their spectacular birth, to their final explosive death, Richard reveals a remarkable world that few of us even realise exists.

programme.title: Great British Railway Journeys
programme.desc: Michael Portillo promises to do his best on the island where Robert Baden Powell began the scout movement in the early 20th century. Joining a group of modern scouts he learns to build a bivouac and finds out what it is about scouting that still appeals to boys and girls today.

programme.title: Byzantium: A Tale of Three Cities
programme.desc: Simon Sebag Montefiore examines the fall of Christian Byzantium and its rebirth as the imperial capital of the Ottoman Muslims.

programme.title: A History of Britain by Simon Schama
programme.desc: Simon Schama tells the story of the reformation from Henry the Eighth's passion for Anne Boleyn to Bloody Mary's unsuccessful attempt to return the country to Roman Catholicism.

programme.title: Panorama
programme.desc: Every year, scammers steal billions from the public, and fraud now represents around 40 per cent of all reported crime in the UK. programme.desc: A family trip to a theme park ends in tears when an accident leaves a dad seriously injured, but the subsequent £1.5 million insurance claim is scuppered when the victim is caught on camera taking everyone for a ride.

programme.title: Homes Under the Hammer
programme.desc: Jacqui visits Broadstairs in Kent, a favourite holiday destination of Charles Dickens, to see a two-bedroom basement garden flat bought by an experienced developer. Martin returns to Burton-on-Trent in Staffordshire to revisit a fire-damaged two-bed terrace he first saw in 2021, and he also heads to Tonypandy in south Wales to visit a four-storey building with potential to convert into separate flats.

programme.title: Bargain Hunt
programme.desc: Charlie Ross presents today's show from Shepton Mallet Antiques, Vintage and Collectors Fair in Somerset. Charlie meets a man who has assembled one of the largest collections of Star Wars toys in the UK.

programme.title: 24/7 Pet Hospital
programme.desc: A Pomeranian puppy called Bear has had an accident and caught her leg in a conservatory door. She sees surgeon Laura, who fits a tiny metal plate to fix her broken bones. It's not always easy treating dogs as small as Bear, but the team adapt.

programme.title: Claimed and Shamed
programme.desc: A career criminal who masterminded an insurance racket worth £250,000 is put back behind bars after investigators expose his wrongdoing. A woman claiming tens of thousands of pounds for an injury caused by a faulty shoe is tripped up by her own evidence and the investigators who stay hot on her heels.

programme.title: Homes Under the Hammer
programme.desc: Former childhood sweethearts who became a couple 35 years later invest in a holiday flat by the Ayrshire coast in Largs, and developers who bought property at auction in Wetherby in Yorkshire and Windsor in Berkshire hope to turn a profit. But just like love, property developing doesn't always run smoothly.

programme.title: Bargain Hunt
programme.desc: Christina Trevanion heads to west Wales, where experts Philip Serrell and Kate Bliss guide our red and blue teams in their search for the best items to sell at auction in Cardiff. Christina carves her own lovespoon as she learns about the Welsh tradition dating back to the 17th century.

programme.title: The Farmers' Country Showdown
programme.desc: Self-taught farming couple SJ and Nat rear their herd of free range pigs in the Pennines near Todmorden, West Yorkshire, and over the past decade have built up a farm that now supports them. They are proud of their award-winning sausages.

programme.title: Escape to the Country
programme.desc: There are two counties for the price of one today as Nicki Chapman visits Somerset and Dorset with a buyer from London who is in search of a new life and a new home in the countryside for her £800k budget. Whilst in the area, Nicki also visits the town of Frome to learn how a fridge is helping to bring the local community together.

programme.title: Antiques Road Trip

programme.title: EastEnders
programme.desc: Whitney's actions cause issues for Stacey, and Linda struggles on her first Valentine's Day without Mick.

programme.title: Waterloo Road
programme.desc: The past catches up with Danny at the end of term show. Meanwhile, Kim is left feeling hurt and betrayed by an unexpected person.

programme.title: Ambulance
programme.desc: Ambulance crew Kate and Femi are dispatched to a young man who is struggling to breathe. It turns out he's suffering from severe anxiety, prompting Nigerian-born Femi to reflect on what he's learned about the people here in the 18 years since he first came to the city.

programme.title: Bad Education
programme.desc: Stephen is desperate to get rid of Mitchell who has moved in after his girlfriend threw him out. So Class K and Stephen give Mitchell a glow up in the hope she'll take him back.

programme.title: Wagspiracy: Vardy v Rooney
programme.desc: In 2019, 'Wagatha Christie' gripped Britain as Coleen Rooney accused Rebekah Vardy of leaking stories about her to the tabloid press. Despite huge media attention on this social media scandal, and a trial that ended up in the high-court in the summer of 2022, with Rooney emerging victorious, the inside story of how and why this extraordinary moment in British culture came to pass, has never fully been told - until now.

programme.title: The Apprentice
programme.desc: It's week six, and the candidates jet off to the cosmopolitan city of Dubai. Here they must put on a corporate away day for two international clients based in the city. While one team shows off the glitz and glam of the city, the other goes for a more traditional approach in the desert. But it's the team with the most profit at the end that will win. Back on home soil, it's the end of the road for another candidate.

programme.title: Morning Live
programme.desc: Join Gethin Jones, Kym Marsh, Sara Cox, Kimberley Walsh, Sam Quek, Rav Wilding and their family of experts for conversation, advice and great company.

programme.title: 24/7 Pet Hospital
programme.desc: A Pomeranian puppy called Bear has had an accident and caught her leg in a conservatory door. She sees surgeon Laura, who fits a tiny metal plate to fix her broken bones. It's not always easy treating dogs as small as Bear, but the team adapt.

programme.title: Claimed and Shamed
programme.desc: A career criminal who masterminded an insurance racket worth £250,000 is put back behind bars after investigators expose his wrongdoing. A woman claiming tens of thousands of pounds for an injury caused by a faulty shoe is tripped up by her own evidence and the investigators who stay hot on her heels.

programme.title: Homes Under the Hammer
programme.desc: Former childhood sweethearts who became a couple 35 years later invest in a holiday flat by the Ayrshire coast in Largs, and developers who bought property at auction in Wetherby in Yorkshire and Windsor in Berkshire hope to turn a profit. But just like love, property developing doesn't always run smoothly.

programme.title: Bargain Hunt
programme.desc: Christina Trevanion heads to west Wales, where experts Philip Serrell and Kate Bliss guide our red and blue teams in their search for the best items to sell at auction in Cardiff. Christina carves her own lovespoon as she learns about the Welsh tradition dating back to the 17th century.

programme.title: BBC News at One
programme.desc: The latest national and international news, followed by weather.

programme.title: Doctors
programme.desc: Daniel and Zara throw Joe a birthday party, Ruhma and Scarlett are confused by Kirsty's living arrangements with Rich, and Sid and an agency nurse clash in a number of unexpected ways.

programme.title: The Farmers' Country Showdown
programme.desc: Self-taught farming couple SJ and Nat rear their herd of free range pigs in the Pennines near Todmorden, West Yorkshire, and over the past decade have built up a farm that now supports them. They are proud of their award-winning sausages.

programme.title: Escape to the Country
programme.desc: There are two counties for the price of one today as Nicki Chapman visits Somerset and Dorset with a buyer from London who is in search of a new life and a new home in the countryside for her £800k budget. Whilst in the area, Nicki also visits the town of Frome to learn how a fridge is helping to bring the local community together.

programme.title: Antiques Road Trip
programme.desc: Antiques experts travel across the nation to search for hidden treasures, from household items to one-of-a kind collectibles. The experts then head to auction to battle it out and make the biggest profit from their items.

programme.title: Bridge of Lies
programme.desc: Ross Kemp presents as a team of four friends, Fiona, Nick, Amy and Laura, take on the Bridge of Lies.

programme.title: Pointless

programme.title: Waterloo Road

programme.title: Ambulance
programme.desc: Ambulance crew Kate and Femi are dispatched to a young man who is struggling to breathe. It turns out he's suffering from severe anxiety, prompting Nigerian-born Femi to reflect on what he's learned about the people here in the 18 years since he first came to the city.

programme.title: Wagspiracy: Vardy v Rooney
programme.desc: In 2019, 'Wagatha Christie' gripped Britain as Coleen Rooney accused Rebekah Vardy of leaking stories about her to the tabloid press. Despite huge media attention on this social media scandal, and a trial that ended up in the high-court in the summer of 2022, with Rooney emerging victorious, the inside story of how and why this extraordinary moment in British culture came to pass, has never fully been told - until now.

programme.title: The Apprentice
programme.desc: It's week six, and the candidates jet off to the cosmopolitan city of Dubai. Here they must put on a corporate away day for two international clients based in the city. While one team shows off the glitz and glam of the city, the other goes for a more traditional approach in the desert. But it's the team with the most profit at the end that will win. Back on home soil, it's the end of the road for another candidate.

programme.title: Six Nations Rugby
programme.desc: Ugo Monye presents highlights from the second round of the Six Nations, featuring the huge game between world number one side Ireland and defending champions France. programme.title: Britain in Bloom
programme.desc: Chris Bavin meets a group of extraordinary Bloomers who must start from scratch every year after their gardening efforts are literally washed away. Tewkesbury in Gloucestershire is at the confluence of four rivers, which makes for a lovely setting, but is one that devastates the town to a greater or lesser degree every year when the waters rise and flood the town.

programme.title: Murder, Mystery and My Family
programme.desc: Leading barristers Sasha Wass and Jeremy Dein examine whether a wealthy female tenant was poisoned by her landlord who she signed over her assets to, just before her death in 1911.

programme.title: Earth's Greatest Spectacles
programme.desc: New England is the stage for the most incredible colour change on Earth - when the vivid greens of summer give way to the golds and reds of the fall. This film revels in the full glory of the spectacle, and reveals how this vibrant fiesta is created by the battles between the trees and the forests inhabitants.

programme.title: Coast and Country Auctions
programme.desc: Spalding Plant and Vegetable Auction in Lincolnshire is the oldest market of its kind in the UK, having started in 1948. There are three sales a week, selling as many as 1000 bags and boxes of veg, and up to 16,000 plants, shrubs and trees in a day.

programme.title: Flog It!
programme.desc: In Blackburn, Anita Manning values a gold charm bracelet, and Philip Serrell takes a shine to an unusual globe. Paul Martin finds about the remarkable life of classical singer Kathleen Ferrier.

programme.desc: Rick returns to Cornwall in the spot where his passion for seafood began, at the exposed rock pools below his parents' old house on the Cornish Atlantic coast. With his freshly foraged mussels, Rick heads home to Padstow.

programme.title: Nadiya's Fast Flavours
programme.desc: Nadiya turns her attention to one of her favourite things, special occasions. She starts with her lemon drizzle swirls. A twist on the cinnamon bun, these fluffy lemon- and cardamom-scented creations are topped with a pillowy citrus frosting.

programme.title: Mastermind
programme.desc: The specialist subjects are U2, toy dog breeds, the Mitford Sisters and guest stars in `Friends'.

programme.title: Only Connect
programme.desc: Six contestants in search of a semi-final place must deal with a series of questions. Find out what connects Hypersensitive immune response, In a manner befitting royalty, and Building for art display.

programme.title: Ordinary Love
programme.desc: Joan and Tom have been married for many years. There is an ease to their relationship that only comes from spending a life time together and a depth of love which expresses itself through tenderness and humour in equal part. When Joan is unexpectedly diagnosed with breast cancer, the course of her treatment shines a light on their relationship as they are faced with the challenges that lie ahead and the prospect of what might happen if something were to happen to her.

programme.title: Countryfile
programme.desc: Sean Fletcher is in Cornwall, but he's not here to explore its fabulous 300-mile coastline. Instead, he will be going underground to unearth the legacy of the county's renowned tin and copper mining industries. Sean encounters an endangered mammal that has set up home in disused mine shafts at Prideaux Wood, and at Penwith we delve underground to discover the history and geology of a 500-year-old tin mine that contains some of the deepest seams in the country.

programme.title: Dragons' Den
programme.desc: Facing the Dragons' wrath this time are a Welsh fashion designer with a selection of handbags made from fish skin; an 18-year-old who hopes to make a withdrawal from the bank of Dragons' Den with his personalised bank card business; two neighbours on a mission to save the high street with their shop local app; and the inventor of an alarm system that tackles van crime before the damage has been done.

programme.title: Make It at Market
programme.desc: Glassblower Belinda from Northamptonshire and upcyclers Becky and Paul from Oxfordshire are hoping Dom and his team can help them turn their passions into profits. Belinda has only been glass-blowing for three years and has recently graduated from university. Becky and husband Paul met and married after their partners both passed away. Now they want to establish a business that will support the two of them so that Paul can give up his painting and decorating job, and they can work together.

programme.title: Danger Mouse

programme.title: Ninja Express

programme.title: Boy Girl Dog Cat Mouse Cheese

programme.title: One Zoo Three

programme.title: Britain's Best Young Artist

They then return to the art studio to create their artworks in the given time. But who will Ricky and Sadie pick to go through to the first semi-final?

programme.desc: Bing and Flop are happily making some ginger bunny biscuits for Charlie and Coco. But when Charlie and Coco arrive, Charlie has done a huge poo and in all the fuss cleaning him up nobody hears the chickie timer ring to tell them that the biscuits are cooked.

programme.title: Teletubbies

programme.title: Chuggington
programme.desc: Zephie and Piper try to prove they are ready for the big jobs in Chuggington by attempting to break some town records.

programme.title: Bing
programme.desc: Bing and Sula are building a stone tower in the Howly Woods when Sula finds an ammonite. Bing wants to find one too but is overwhelmed by the amount of stones, which makes it very difficult to find one. A frustrated Bing sits down, and Sula notices some ammonites in the rock behind him. Flop takes a picture of Bing and Sula with their ammonites.

programme.title: Colourblocks
programme.desc: Purple stages a version of Little Red Riding Hood, but the other Colourblocks struggle to stick to the story. Learn about colour mixing with the Colourblocks.

programme.title: Hey Duggee
programme.desc: The Squirrels are playing hide and seek but they can't find Happy. Duggee can though: he follows Happy's footprints. The Squirrels follow lots of different footprints that take them to their friend, but there is one set they just can't work out.

programme.title: Hey Duggee
programme.desc: The Squirrels are digging in the garden when they find a fossil, so Duggee and Narrator explain all about fossils and prehistoric times. When the Squirrels go outside, it seems like they've gone right back in time.

programme.title: Bluey
programme.desc: While Dad and his mates pull out some tree stumps in the garden, Bluey, Bingo and Muffin turn one stump into a nail salon. When it comes time to pull out the girls' stump, Dad must strike a deal.

programme.title: Bluey
programme.desc: Mum reminisces about Bluey and Judo as babies. Bluey learnt to roll over first, but Judo was the first to crawl, so then it became a race to see who was going to walk first.

programme.title: Peter Rabbit
programme.desc: When a big storm wrecks the rabbits' tree house, piecing it back together leads to big adventure.

programme.title: Octonauts
programme.desc: The Octonauts discover a hidden lake.

programme.title: Numberblocks
programme.desc: Twenty and chums find out what happens when you go past bus stop 20. Learn about the numbers 21, 22 and 23 with the Numberblocks.

programme.title: Oti's Boogie Beebies
programme.desc: Oti teaches us how to zoom to the moon.

programme.title: Bing
programme.desc: Bing goes to play with Sula, who is engrossed in a game of sparkle magic when he arrives. Bing wants to play too but Sula won't let him.

programme.title: Yakka Dee
programme.desc: Dee encourages a friend to say `egg' and we go on a whirlwind word adventure. We see lots of different eggs, a brown egg, a white egg, we even see inside an egg. There's a dippy egg, a fried egg, an egg being laid and what will come out of the hatching egg? There's a gold egg, a cold egg and Dee and her friends even have an egg and spoon race.

programme.title: Messy Goes to OKIDO
programme.desc: It's the OKIDO circus today, and Messy is worried about performing his triple flip. His friends try to help him conquer his tummy flutters before the audience arrives.

programme.title: Colourblocks
programme.desc: Purple stages a version of Little Red Riding Hood, but the other Colourblocks struggle to stick to the story. Learn about colour mixing with the Colourblocks.

programme.title: Twirlywoos
programme.desc: The Twirlywoos watch a waiter set a wedding table in a marquee. The waiter places plates and cutlery next to each other. The Twirlywoos help by getting items from outside and placing them next to the plates. The bride and groom enter and are amazed.

programme.title: Something Special
programme.desc: Mr Tumble tries to teach Spotty the horse some new skills, whilst Justin and his friends meet some alpacas, a pig called Alan and a great grey owl.

programme.title: Teletubbies
programme.desc: The children in Tummy Tales play a game of pass the parcel and win a surprise toy, while the Dup Dup delivers toys for the Teletubbies to play with and even Noo-Noo enjoys a new treat.

programme.title: The Toddler Club at Home
programme.desc: Gemma, Benjee Bear and Bailee Bear welcome toddlers Joshua, Kyomi, Chester and Isaac, and their grown-ups, to the Toddler Club. Parents, carers and their little ones at home are invited to join in with all the fun activities too. The What's in the Box? game reveals a toy seagull, and when the toddlers and parents open up a bigger box, they discover lots more objects and toys that are inspired by things you might find at the beach.

programme.title: Small Potatoes
programme.desc: Animated preschool series that features four adorable potatoes who sing and dance as they explore.

programme.title: Hey Duggee
programme.desc: The Squirrels are trying to count how many badges Duggee has when they come across his Counting Badge. He got it for counting to 100.This sounds like hard work.

programme.title: Roots and Fruits
programme.desc: Live from the Roots and Fruits Theatre, it's the spectacular acrobatic grapes working together to perform the most difficult structures to perfection.

programme.title: B.O.T. and The Beasties
programme.desc: The plant where the Flying Itchies live is under threat of being eaten by the Purple Muncher. To save their plant, the Itchies make the Muncher very itchy indeed! B.O.T. has to keep clear of both the Itchies and the Muncher to complete this mission.

programme.title: Bluey
programme.desc: Dad demonstrates to Bluey and Bingo just how difficult it is to look after a pet.

programme.title: Let's Go for a Walk
programme.desc: Ranger Hamza and the Ramblers go on a special walk through the town that starts in the daytime but finishes with a torch game in the dark. On the way they spot a spiky tree, have a close-up look at a daisy and light up their reflectors in the dark.

programme.title: School of Roars
programme.desc: Miss Grizzlesniff takes the monsters to a cave to practise their roars.

programme.title: Teeny Tiny Creatures
programme.desc: Carys wants to find out all about jellyfish. Chantelle visits an aquarium which is home to some rather special jellyfish, whilst Rory meets a marine expert and they head out to sea on a glass-bottomed boat. Chantelle and Rory's fact files help answer all of Carys's questions.

programme.title: Our Family
programme.desc: It's Elba's birthday and sister Iona is planning a very special tea party for her. Iona and Elba decorate the bedroom ready for the big party, and there are lots of balloons and games to enjoy.

programme.title: What's on Your Head?
programme.desc: Lucy the helicopter paramedic shows us her helmet. She tells us all about how important her helmet is, and how it helps her to do her job and help people.

programme.title: Big Cook Little Cook
programme.desc: Jen has brought in a bag of wigs, but she needs a mirror to see what she looks like. Hassina the hairdresser comes to visit, Small flies on her magic spoon to find out how biscuits are iced, and they make hairdo cookies for their fancy friend.

programme.title: Woolly & Tig
programme.desc: Tig builds a sandcastle at the beach and wants to take it home with her. Woolly explains to Tig that the sand belongs to the beach and the sea.

programme.title: Waffle the Wonder Dog
programme.desc: Waffle, Simon, Doug, Evie and Ruby do a sponsored silence to raise money for the school. It's not much fun, so Mrs Hobbs suggests they do a jigsaw. Waffle finds the missing piece.

programme.title: Tee and Mo
programme.desc: Tee is excited about a day on the beach but soon finds out that the sea is a bit wet. It's now up to Mo to teach Tee that splashing in the water is fun.

programme.title: Pablo
programme.desc: Pablo finds an itchy label in his t-shirt and decides not to get dressed. He makes himself into a duvetsaurus, so he can be like his Book Animal friends and not wear clothes.

programme.title: Yakka Dee
programme.desc: Yakka Dee! celebrates children communicating - because talking fills you up with whizz, pop, bang! In this episode, Dee encourages a friend to say 'ball' and we go on a whirlwind word adventure. We see lots of different balls and explore how they look and what they do. There's a green ball, a blue ball and even a ball that goes moo! There's a seat ball, some meatballs and a funny ball too. We see a ball to kick, a ball for disco dancing and a sparkly ball on a Christmas tree.

programme.title: Numberblocks
programme.desc: Twenty enters the Pattern Palace to find out who his Twenty-friends are, and it's time to learn about number bonds to 20 with the Numberblocks.

programme.title: Alphablocks
programme.desc: I wants to show off her incredible singing but when she holds hands with N, they get stuck inside a floating balloon. Can word magic help them out or will I's singing save the day? This episode introduces the letters I and N and the words 'tin', 'tip' and 'pin'.

programme.title: Dog Loves Books
programme.desc: The bookshop is very cold, so Dog and Pug go to the Antarctic to find out how animals there keep warm. They discover that by running up and down hills they can keep warm.

programme.title: Hey Duggee
programme.desc: The squirrels are playing in the clubhouse. Naughty Monkey arrives and causes chaos! He later returns to his home to relax when there is a knock at his door. His cousins have come to visit.

programme.title: Love Monster
programme.desc: When The In Chicks invent a new game, Love Monster and Tiniest Fluffiest Bunny have a great time playing it. But their turn soon ends, and the friends have to wait in a very long line for their next go.

programme.title: Let's Dance
programme.desc: Toe-tapping fun.

programme.title: Something Special
programme.desc: Mr Tumble tries to teach Spotty the horse some new skills, whilst Justin and his friends meet some alpacas, a pig called Alan and a great grey owl.

programme.title: Teletubbies
programme.desc: The Teletubbies get very messy when the tubby custard machine takes them on a tubby custard ride which splats tubby custard everywhere. The children in Tummy Tales have messy fun with art in the park.

programme.title: Bluey
programme.desc: Dad demonstrates to Bluey and Bingo just how difficult it is to look after a pet.

programme.title: My Petsaurus
programme.desc: Topsy has been having fun in the garden and has become completely caked in mud! It's up to Chloe to get him into the bath and give him a good clean.

programme.title: Maddie's Do You Know?
programme.desc: Maddie is having fun by the beach. She finds out how waves are formed far out to sea when the wind blows and how some of them are made by the tides. She visits a surfing centre and takes to the waves on a surfboard.

programme.title: Dog Squad
programme.desc: Kika is a golden Labrador and a guide dog for her owner Dr Amit, who is blind. She is trained to use her supersight to help him do as many things as he can by himself. Together, they make the best team. Kika needs to help Dr Amit catch a train to the city. First, they must walk to the station. Kika knows the way like the back of her paw, but there are some important things they must do along the way.

programme.title: Swashbuckle
programme.desc: Line loves singing so much, he has decided that he will start his very own pirate choir. Cook is obviously eager to join him on this musical adventure, but Captain HeyHo doesn't seem too sure. Line, however, won't take no for answer.

programme.title: Hey Duggee
programme.desc: The squirrels learn all about where water comes from, and their journey takes them from the sea and back to the kitchen sink and another drink of water. Wow! Water is amazing!

programme.title: Peter Rabbit
programme.desc: Peter is left to babysit Cotton-tail but can't resist an exciting event at the Squirrel camp. He brings his sleeping sister along but soon must rescue her when she wakes up and crawls away.

programme.title: Andy's Global Adventures
programme.desc: Andy, Jen and Scout head to Antarctica on a global adventure in search of brown patches on the ice. Along the way, they meet some emperor penguins.

programme.title: Pinocchio and friends
programme.desc: Teaching Cricket to swim, Pinocchio and Freeda accidentally send him to a pirate galleon.

programme.title: Bluey
programme.desc: Mum reminisces about Bluey and Judo as babies. Bluey learnt to roll over first, but Judo was the first to crawl, so then it became a race to see who was going to walk first.

programme.title: Bluey
programme.desc: While Dad and his mates pull out some tree stumps in the garden, Bluey, Bingo and Muffin turn one stump into a nail salon. When it comes time to pull out the girls' stump, Dad must strike a deal.

programme.title: Supertato
programme.desc: Evil Pea swaps Supertato's Tato-Belt with her evil Baddie-Belt which has absurd and baffling functions. Supertato has to work out how to rescue Carrot and Pea with the Baddie-Belt.

programme.title: Go Jetters
programme.desc: Lars and Kyan swim through the shallows of Crystal River in Florida. Kyan tests his new swimming fin, while Lars watches a manatee and her baby cruise by. Xuli is water-skiing further downstream in the open waters of Crystal Bay.

programme.title: Molly and Mack
programme.desc: Molly examines her shelf of special things at the back of Mack's stall. She chooses the `Very Berry Delights' pot and remembers the day she got it. Bob has a big order from Mrs Juniper for berries, but the birds keep stealing them from his allotment and he's about to run out. Meanwhile, Mrs Juniper is proudly selling her 'Very Berry Delights' in little pots. Moira's too busy to have one as she's having a clearout.

programme.title: Biff and Chip
programme.desc: Biff gives her toy train to Kipper but quickly regrets her decision. She tries to get her toy back but learns that when you give something away, you can't always get it back.

programme.title: Nick Cope's Popcast
programme.desc: Nick and his grandson Remie create a Popcast Song about a spider who lives in a bucket.

programme.title: JoJo & Gran Gran
programme.desc: JoJo and Gran Gran go ice skating. Whilst Gran Gran is a little nervous JoJo is a natural. With Jared's help Gran Gran soon gets the hang of it.

programme.title: Moon and Me
programme.desc: When Pepi Nana loses her red pencil, Little Nana finds it under the wardrobe. Because she is small, Little Nana sees things that Pepi Nana might not see. The two friends go for a walk, and along the way Little Nana shows Pepi Nana lots of new things.

programme.title: Clangers
programme.desc: Mother Clanger has grown a beautiful new flower, but when Tiny, Small and Major see it they realise it is the source of the horrible smell they have been experiencing.

programme.title: In the Night Garden
programme.desc: The Pontipines play hide and seek with the Wottingers who walk through the garden looking for places to hide while the Pontipines count. Then the Pontipines and the Wottingers ride in the Ninky Nonk all the way home.

programme.title: Cbeebies Bedtime Stories
programme.desc: A different story read by a special guest each night just before bedtime.

programme.title: This Is CBeebies
programme.desc: Welcome to the CBeebies channel. Programmes start at 6.00am.

programme.title: This Is CBeebies
programme.desc: Welcome to the CBeebies channel. Programmes start at 6.00am.

programme.title: This Is CBeebies

programme.title: Raa Raa the Noisy Lion
programme.desc: Raa Raa and his friends hear a strange noise and find a set of tracks in the Jungle, but what could be making them?

programme.title: Bing
programme.desc: Bing and Pando experiment with Bing's toy train on the Fun Fort in the playground. The train is good at going over bridges and brilliant at going down the slide. But when Bing slides it off the roof of the playhouse, the train crashes and breaks. Bing is upset until he realises that the pieces fit together to make something completely different.

programme.title: Teletubbies
programme.desc: Tinky Winky, Dipsy, Laa-­-Laa and Po want to go outside but it's raining. Some wellies and umbrellas magically appear and the Teletubbies go outside for splashy, rainy fun.

programme.title: School of Roars
programme.desc: Wufflebump discovers that it's Miss Sneezle's birthday so he plans a monster-mazing surprise with the help of his classmates and the full moon.

programme.title: Chuggington
programme.desc: Brewster tries to get busy Action Chugger to play a game of hide-and-seek, but in his zest to prove he is best friends with Action Chugger, Brewster puts his relationships with Koko and Wilson on the line.

programme.title: Bing
programme.desc: 'You can't stop the bangs but you can help them be quiet.' Sula and Amma go round to Bing's house to watch the fireworks.

programme.title: Colourblocks
programme.desc: The Colourblocks enjoy a dance. Find out which colours make the best partners. Learn about similar and complementary colours with the Colourblocks.

programme.title: Hey Duggee
programme.desc: Duggee is cleaning the clubhouse so the Squirrels take refuge in the treehouse, but it's getting a little bit cramped. Norrie has an idea, they need to add an extension.

programme.title: Hey Duggee
programme.desc: It's a very windy day and the Squirrels want to play outside. Duggee knows what to do, he's flying his kite. The Squirrels make their own kites to fly.

programme.title: Bluey
programme.desc: At dinner, the Heelers play a game called `My Favorite Thing Today' and take turns remembering their favourite thing from the day. However, when Bluey laughs at something her sister said earlier, Bingo's mood darkens.

programme.title: Bluey
programme.desc: Grandad is supposed to be resting, but when Bluey and Bingo go to visit him, he makes a run for it with the kids and takes them on a madcap adventure into the bush.

programme.title: Peter Rabbit
programme.desc: When Peter, Lily and Benjamin go out to collect firewood, they soon find that not one but three predators are after some too. Can the rabbits stage a series of daring raids to retrieve it?

programme.title: Octonauts
programme.desc: The Octonauts have an Octopod mysery to solve.

programme.title: Numberblocks
programme.desc: The squares explore an ancient temple in search of a really, really big square. Learn more about square numbers with the Numberblocks.

programme.title: Love Monster
programme.desc: Love Monster is hosting his first stargazing party, putting up star-themed decorations all over his garden and giving his guests special flower crowns. After turning off the lights, they all enjoy gazing at the shooting stars.

programme.title: Oti's Boogie Beebies
programme.desc: Oti teaches us how to twist.

programme.title: Justin's House
programme.desc: Justin Fletcher entertains a live audience of children with singing, dancing and comedy chaos. Robert is being judged for a special robot award but he is too nervous to pass all the tests, so Justin decides to take the tests for him.

programme.title: Bing
programme.desc: Bing wants to dig the biggest hole and gets upset when Pando accidentally fills it in. It takes Flop to show them how they can work together to be just like the digger men they saw planting a tree in the park earlier.

programme.title: Yakka Dee
programme.desc: Dee encourages a friend to say 'shoes' and we go on a whirlwind word adventure. This episode is all about shoes - brown shoes, blue shoes, shiny shoes and new shoes. We see flashy shoes and dashy shoes, loud shoes and even flying shoes!

programme.title: Messy Goes to OKIDO
programme.desc: Messy's hiccups cause a landslide while he is out on a nature walk. Find out if he can stop hiccupping and make his way home.

programme.title: Colourblocks
programme.desc: The Colourblocks enjoy a dance. Find out which colours make the best partners. Learn about similar and complementary colours with the Colourblocks.

programme.title: Twirlywoos
programme.desc: An artist is drawing a dog in a room. The dog wants to go out, so the artist opens the door. After a while, the artist opens the door again and calls the dog back inside. The Twirlywoos decide to open and close the door to let the dog in and out.

programme.title: Something Special
programme.desc: Justin and his friends enjoy a day exploring the forest, whilst Mr Tumble goes on a nature hunt with Tumble Ted.

programme.title: Teletubbies
programme.desc: Laa-Laa makes up a lovely song about all of the things she sees on her walk across Teletubbyland. Afterwards, she sings a song to Tinky Winky, Dipsy and Po. They sing the song together and watch a children's choir sing in Tummy Tales.

programme.title: The Toddler Club at Home
programme.desc: Nigel, Benjee Bear and Bailee Bear welcome toddlers Joshua, Inam, Liyana, Maisy, Francis and Arabella, and their grown-ups, to the Toddler Club. Parents, carers and their little ones at home are invited to join in with all the fun activities too. The What's in the Box? game reveals a pair of stripy socks, and when the toddlers and parents open up a bigger box, they discover lots more objects and toys that are inspired by patterns. This theme is explored through play, song and story.

programme.title: Small Potatoes
programme.desc: Ruby sings an upbeat, techno song where she imagines what it's like to be a raindrop falling down from the sky.

programme.title: Hey Duggee
programme.desc: We join the Squirrels mid-air in the middle of a tricky situation. What has just happened Squirrels? The Squirrels try to explain the story leading up to where they are but are not telling the story in order.

programme.title: Roots and Fruits
programme.desc: Live from the Roots and Fruits Theatre, it's Banana revealing an astonishing secret about herself in the opera piece, I've Got a Secret.

programme.title: B.O.T. and The Beasties
programme.desc: The Glowy Spotter uses its antennae to paint bright spots on the ground and B.O.T. gets spotty too.

programme.title: Bluey
programme.desc: Dad takes care of the girls' evening routine when Mum heads out to a baby shower, and he has to try extra hard to keep them entertained.

programme.title: Let's Go for a Walk
programme.desc: Ranger Hamza and the Ramblers walk through the town to the beach, where they are all going to take part in a litter-pick. On the way, they pretend to be mermaids, spin like wind turbines, run from their shadows and even paddle down a crystal river.

programme.title: School of Roars
programme.desc: In a race to be the best, Wufflebump keeps pushing in to get what he wants.

programme.title: Teeny Tiny Creatures
programme.desc: Harriet wants to find out all about blue tits. Chantelle visits a school and discovers that they have a bird box which is currently home to a family of blue tits, whilst Rory meet a young birdwatcher in her garden. Chantelle and Rory's fact files help answer all of Harriet's questions.

programme.title: Our Family
programme.desc: Iona and Elba make bird feeders as a present for their Nanny Pip and Gramps, who they are visiting. They place the feeders around the garden and wait patiently for birds to arrive, hoping they'll discover the tasty treats.

programme.title: What's on Your Head?
programme.desc: Firefighter Karen shows off her helmet. See how important it is for Karen to wear it while she does her heroic job, as well as some of the amazing things it does.

programme.title: Big Cook Little Cook
programme.desc: The chefs are getting ready for a wedding, and Jen is wearing her prized hat. Sunny Sun comes to visit, Small flies off to see how ketchup is made, and the two chefs cook a sweet and sour hat for their beaming guest.

programme.title: Woolly & Tig
programme.desc: Tig unwraps a bike for her birthday. Tig just wants to push the bike and will not take advice on how to ride it. Woolly persuades Tig that she might have more fun if she asks her Mum to show her how to ride the bike.

programme.title: Waffle the Wonder Dog
programme.desc: The Brooklyn-Bells take Waffle to school to ask if he can visit class. When Headteacher, Mr Nolan, says no, Waffle goes missing, he's determined to prove he's ready for school.

programme.title: Tee and Mo
programme.desc: Mo encourages Tee to have a `Tee Can Do It' day where he tries to do everything without help from her. She soon realises that Tee doing everything himself gives her lots more work.

programme.title: Pablo
programme.desc: When Pablo gets a birthday present after his birthday, it is very confusing. He doesn't want to open it, because he doesn't know what's inside and doesn't like surprises.

programme.title: Yakka Dee
programme.desc: Yakka Dee! celebrates children communicating - because talking fills you up with whizz, pop, bang! In this episode, Dee encourages a friend to say 'mouse' and we go on a whirlwind word adventure. Dee meets lots of different mice. She meets a brown mouse, a furry mouse and a whiskery mouse. There's a squeaky mouse, a cheeky mouse and a sleepy mouse.

programme.title: Numberblocks
programme.desc: The Numberblocks compete in the finals of the Ten-vaulting contest. Learn about adding past ten with the Numberblocks.

programme.title: Alphablocks
programme.desc: M is very hungry so he and his friends make a gingerbread man, but he runs off. They set chase on a flying mat, and a handy map keeps them hot on his trail. Can they corner the cheeky biscuit? This episode introduces the letter M and the words 'mat', 'map' and 'man'.

programme.title: Dog Loves Books
programme.desc: While trying to solve a puzzle, Dog and Pug end up looking for a Minotaur in an ancient maze. After a number of false turns, they reach the centre and find the friendly Minotaur. Pug realises that there are a number of ways to solve puzzles.

programme.title: Hey Duggee
programme.desc: Ding dong, there is somebody at the door. It is delivery Chipmunk with a parcel for Duggee, but why is it wrapped up like a present? Maybe it is Duggee's birthday.

programme.title: Love Monster
programme.desc: It's Favourite Hat Day, so Love Monster proudly puts on his favourite knitted and decorated hat. But just before he heads out, he notices that it has started to unravel! Insisting he can still wear it, Love Monster pushes the loose yarn back up.

programme.title: Let's Dance
programme.desc: Learn a hula-inspired routine with Miss Kylie.

programme.title: Something Special
programme.desc: Justin and his friends enjoy a day exploring the forest, whilst Mr Tumble goes on a nature hunt with Tumble Ted.

programme.title: Teletubbies
programme.desc: Tinky Winky, Laa-Laa and Po laugh themselves silly with a funny joke but when they tell it to Dipsy, it doesn't tickle Dipsy in the same way. But Dipsy's funny dance does and when Dipsy dances again, the Teletubbies all laugh together. In Tummy Tales, children have fun being silly in a park.

programme.title: Bluey
programme.desc: Dad takes care of the girls' evening routine when Mum heads out to a baby shower, and he has to try extra hard to keep them entertained.

programme.title: My Petsaurus
programme.desc: Chloe is trying to watch her favourite programme, but is constantly interrupted by a fidgety, sofa-hogging Topsy.

programme.title: Maddie's Do You Know?
programme.desc: In today's episode, Maddie find out about books! First, she visits a library to learn how all the different types of books are stored in different sections. Then she uses her special cameras to show how the librarian helps us find a book in the library. We see how the books are sorted so that they all go back in the right place. Next, Maddie goes to a factory where books are made. She finds out how books start out as a big sheet of blank paper. Maddie shows us how this paper is printed with ink.

programme.title: Dog Squad
programme.desc: Meagaidh the Border Collie is a search and rescue dog who works with her owner Tom. Her supernose follows scents and smells like clues, so they can rescue people who need their help. Joe and his daughter Kate are in trouble at the top of a really steep hill. They are lost, cold, soggy, tired and hungry. And they've dropped their picnic bag down a hill. Joe manages to contact Tom at the Woofton Search and Rescue Centre, just before the battery on his phone runs out.

programme.title: Swashbuckle
programme.desc: Cook and Line are very tired as they are being kept awake at night by a noisy snorer. Captain HeyHo insists it isn't her and comes up with various suggestions as to what the mysterious snoring noise could be. Cook and Line don't seem convinced.

programme.title: Hey Duggee
programme.desc: It's a hot day so Duggee is treating the Squirrels to a trip to the tropical lake. It's particularly busy out today and there's a traffic jam! Thank goodness Duggee has his traffic badge. He knows what to do!

programme.title: Peter Rabbit
programme.desc: When Cotton-tail's birthday cake is stolen and Peter vows to get it back, he finds himself in hot water with a host of angry villains!

programme.title: Andy's Global Adventures
programme.desc: Andy, Jen and Scout head to the Kalahari Desert in Southern Africa on a global adventure in search of the elusive aardvark.

programme.title: Pinocchio and friends
programme.desc: Pinocchio and his friends sail towards Shark's Island, hoping to save Papa Geppetto.

programme.title: Bluey
programme.desc: Grandad is supposed to be resting, but when Bluey and Bingo go to visit him, he makes a run for it with the kids and takes them on a madcap adventure into the bush.

programme.title: Bluey
programme.desc: At dinner, the Heelers play a game called `My Favorite Thing Today' and take turns remembering their favourite thing from the day. However, when Bluey laughs at something her sister said earlier, Bingo's mood darkens.

programme.title: Supertato
programme.desc: Chilli decides to become a superhero called Super Chilli. His superhero skills are put to the test when Evil Pea covers Supertato in sticky honey, but Chilli's heat saves the day.

programme.title: Go Jetters
programme.desc: While Xuli and Kyan brush up on their Vroomster skills, Tala, Lars and Foz help the Academy's banana crop by removing some vines that were constricting the trees. Nearby, Glitch prepares a picnic for Ubercorn. Tala drops by to deliver some bananas.

programme.title: Topsy and Tim
programme.desc: Jocelyn MacNab, Joshua Lester, Anna Acton, Tom Price, Mona Goodwin, Tom Hibberd. Live-action children's show following the everyday adventures of two fun-loving twins. It's Topsy and Tim's last day at nursery school and Tony Welch's dad is going to take a special class photo. Unfortunately, Miss Maypole calls to say that nursery must close for the morning. Topsy and Tim decide to host the last day of nursery school at their house and invite all of their class friends!

programme.title: Dipdap
programme.desc: Series in which a drawn line creates endless challenges and surprises for the unsuspecting little character, Dipdap. Here, Dipdap thinks the balloons will keep him out of the mud, but the line has other ideas.

programme.title: Biff and Chip
programme.desc: Sam is at the Robinson's making a surprise present for Kerry. There is just one problem: Kerry is also at the Robinson's making a surprise present for Sam.

programme.title: Sarah & Duck
programme.desc: Sarah and her best friend Duck embark on simple but exciting adventures, exploring the world both near and far in their own wobbly and imaginative way. Scarf Lady welcomes Sarah and Duck to her house full of scarves.

programme.title: JoJo & Gran Gran
programme.desc: JoJo and Gran Gran head to the library in search of the new Captain Chloe book, but they discover the children's section is closed for redecoration. JoJo, Gran Gran and their friends all help to paint a pirate picture on the library wall.

programme.title: Moon and Me
programme.desc: Pepi Nana, Mr Onion, Little Nana and their friends discover a paper star on the ceiling of the little toy house. In Storyland, they find a sky full of twinkly stars to wonder about.

programme.title: Clangers
programme.desc: It's the Clangers' cleaning day. All the Clangers are doing a good job dusting but how will they reach all the dustweeds they can see on the ceiling of the living cave?

programme.title: In the Night Garden
programme.desc: Upsy Daisy is singing with her megaphone in the garden. Here comes Upsy Daisy's bed. Upsy Daisy isn't tired though and sends her bed away. Makka Pakka wants to wash Upsy daisy's face but Upsy Daisy only wants to sing.

programme.desc: Luke Evans reads a bedtime story about Bear who loves nothing more than relaxing on his own, and his best friend, Duck, who has different ideas.

programme.title: Dando: 20 Year Hunt For A Killer
programme.desc: Re-examining the case of Jill Dando's murder, the BBC presenter who was mercilessly shot dead as she entered her Fulham home in April 1999. Two years after her death, Barry George was found guilty of her murder, but following a dramatic retrial in 2008, he was acquitted and released from prison. Now more than 20 years on, looking back at some of the unanswered questions surrounding the case.

programme.desc: Inspired by the discovery that the farm is over 700 years old, Edith and Violet search an old barn for signs of life left behind by previous shepherding families. Clemmy helps Amanda treat a ewe with a nasty ailment.

programme.title: GPs: Behind Closed Doors
programme.desc: Dr Amir Khan meets James who's very frank about his heart failure diagnosis and two prior heart attacks. Dr Claire Taylor meets Cheryl who is experiencing problems with digestion.

programme.title: Dogs Behaving (Very) Badly
programme.desc: A nature-loving couple's hyperreactive Doberman makes it impossible to enjoy walks in the countryside surrounding Swansea. Graeme must see if he can make this unruly canine see sense.

programme.title: Ben Fogle: New Lives in the Wild
programme.desc: Ben journeys into Zambia to live with a British family who have built a safari lodge on the edge of a national park, overcoming fire, flooding and dangerous wildlife.

programme.title: Dando: 20 Year Hunt For A Killer
programme.desc: Re-examining the case of Jill Dando's murder, the BBC presenter who was mercilessly shot dead as she entered her Fulham home in April 1999. Two years after her death, Barry George was found guilty of her murder, but following a dramatic retrial in 2008, he was acquitted and released from prison. Now more than 20 years on, looking back at some of the unanswered questions surrounding the case.

programme.title: The Leovegas Live Casino Show
programme.desc: An interactive live casino show featuring live roulette wheels and other casino games.

programme.title: Entertainment News On 5
programme.desc: A daily round-up of showbiz news and gossip from around the world, focusing on celebrities, movies, music and entertainment.

programme.title: The Yorkshire Steam Railway: All Aboard
programme.desc: It has been a challenging season, but things are on track. Under pressure to bring in extra revenue now that the season is closing, the NYMR team decide to put on a curry train night and a massive bash for Halloween.

programme.title: Paddington Station 24/7
programme.desc: A track circuit failure closes a platform which is used by high-speed trains, British Transport Police are out in force as rival Oxford and Millwall fans use the network, and a young man is seen on CCTV walking close to the edge of the platform.

programme.title: Great Artists
programme.desc: Art historian Tim Marlow looks at German Renaissance artist Albrecht Durer, who excelled at woodcutting and etching, but also became one of the earliest masters of oil painting, his efforts helping to establish the artistic traditions of Northern Europe as equal to those of Italy.

programme.title: Salvage Dawgs
programme.desc: Mike, Robert and the crew salvage an iron-ore facility that was converted to a cannery in the 1930s. Mike builds a custom bar from an old Cissell steam-press table.

programme.title: Salvage Dawgs
programme.desc: The crew save copper elements from the St. Andrews Catholic Church spires in Roanoke, Virginia, learning about a large lithograph from a previous salvage. Mike's daughter Grace builds a bookshelf from a panel door and old tin.

programme.title: Outback Opal Hunters
programme.desc: New team The Bushmen clash with opal thieves raiding one of their mines. The Cookes hack an old digging machine, while the Fire Crew hunt for a new deposit of rare black opal.

programme.title: Alaskan Bush People
programme.desc: Billy gets overambitious on a late barter as the family tries to secure their winter stores. Plus, a rogue bear plays havoc with Browntown and a nearby logging camp.

programme.title: Alaskan Bush People
programme.desc: Deep in the Alaskan bush lives a family who was born and raised wild. Billy and Amy Brown - and their seven children - live off the grid and rely on each other to survive.

programme.title: Alaska: The Last Frontier
programme.desc: The clan have 48 hours to build a cattle fence and rebuild a cabin, or the treacherous river's tide will trap their barge full of critical equipment for another month.

programme.title: Alaska: The Last Frontier
programme.desc: With summer half over the Kilchers head out fishing. They need hundreds of pounds of fish to eat and barter with during winter.

programme.title: Yukon Men
programme.desc: Joey discovers a large predator has been stealing bait off his trapline, and takes action to save his livelihood. James takes his sons on their first hunt.

programme.title: Aussie Gold Hunters
programme.desc: Henri and Kellie face poachers and a dry streak. Also, the `Dirt Dogs' need to break new ground in order to stay in business, while the `Gold Gypsies' search for precious reef gold.

programme.title: Gold Divers
programme.desc: Only one day remains of the 2015 ice mining season; the miners are determined to prove the risks have been worth it.

programme.title: Homestead Rescue
programme.desc: The Raneys must save an Oregon homestead trapped at the bottom of a 100 foot cliff separating them from four acres of land they need for food and livestock.

programme.title: Building Off the Grid
programme.desc: Michael Reynolds and his team of builders face the difficult task of building an Earthship home in just four weeks in Montana. The house must be entirely self-sufficient and sustainable.

programme.title: Scrap Kings
programme.desc: A double decker bus reaches its final stop in Barnsley. A traditional fairground ride is saved from the scrap yard, but will its painstaking restoration pay off?

programme.title: Outback Opal Hunters
programme.desc: Bushmen Rod and Les risk their lives reopening a long-abandoned mine. New team the Young Guns go deep underground for the first time, hunting pineapple opal.

programme.title: Deadliest Catch

programme.title: Alaska: The Last Frontier

programme.title: Jade Fever
programme.desc: The race to pack up camp at Wolverine becomes a nightmare when heat, sickness and a forest fire descend on the crew.

programme.title: Jade Fever
programme.desc: The brutal trek to a new mine site separates the family and pushes Josh to his breaking point; scrappy Larry struggles to keep his extra-wide army truck on the steep and narrow road.

programme.title: The Great Interior Design Challenge
programme.desc: In the fourth series of this competition, renowned interior designer Kelly Hoppen MBE joins Daniel Hopwood on the judging panel as a new crop of amateur interior designers try their best to win the title. The hopefuls complete a series of home renovation challenges in knockout rounds; of those eliminated the judges choose one wildcard option to continue in the contest. Tasks involve transforming three similar rooms in three similar neighbouring properties following a brief from the owners. The contestants vie in heats of three in the opening round, with the winners progressing through to the final. Architectural historian Tom Dyckhoff is the show's presenter.

programme.title: Queen Victoria's Last Love: Abdul Karim
programme.desc: Victoria's friendship with her Scottish servant John Brown is a familiar story. Her relationship with Abdul Karim is less well known and yet produced even greater shockwaves in the Palace. He introduced her to the delights of Indian cuisine, fed her romantic visions of India, and taught her Hindustani. Their relationship violated Victorian taboos of race and class and threatened the 1897 Diamond Jubilee.

programme.title: The Huggetts Abroad
programme.desc: When Jimmy gets work in South Africa, the family decide to go with Jimmy and travel there by truck.

programme.title: Vengeance Valley
programme.desc: After returning from a cattle drive, Colorado ranch foreman Owen Daybright and his foster brother, Lee Strobie, learn that unmarried Lily Fasken is about to give birth. Owen goes to visit her and discovers she hasn't much support, so he gives her some money. Her brother, Dick, suspects that Owen is the father and eventually Owen is driven out of town.

programme.title: Dancing With Crime
programme.desc: A woman and a cabbie put the finger on a gang of hoods using a dance parlour as a front for black-market activities.

programme.title: Crown Court
programme.desc: A father and son are accused of smuggling £200,000-worth of heroin into the country.

programme.title: Hell Drivers
programme.desc: A man fresh out of prison and seeking anonymity takes a job with unscrupulous haulage contractors whose drivers are forced to make death-defying runs as part of a money-making scam. When one of the man's colleagues is killed by the two ringleaders, he is determined to put an end to the racket.

programme.title: Rhubarb
programme.desc: Every trick of gamesmanship or blatant cheating occurs in a round of golf.

programme.title: The Main Chance
programme.desc: David's former secretary Sarah is divorcing her husband Lord Radchester and David is acting for her. Lord Radchester will stop at nothing to get the terms he wants whilst David's new agent Walter Clegg finds himself a little out of his depth.

programme.title: Perfect Friday
programme.desc: A staid bank employee decides to break loose from his humdrum life and use his position to change his life. A beautiful customer and her jaded aristocratic husband, desperate for cash to maintain their jet-set existence, provide the ideal accomplices for the perfect crime.

programme.desc: Count Arnim has formed a highly efficient organisation for extorting money by blackmail.

Unable to bear children, they adopt an infant daughter, only for her to die just a few years later. Roger, wracked by guilt and loathing, sees no future for their marriage but redemption for both awaits.
